text: A constructor in Java is a special method used to initialize objects. It is called when an object is created.
What is the difference between '==’ and '.equals()'
'==' checks for reference equality, while '.equals()' checks for content equality between two objects.
An interface in Java is a collection of abstract methods that a class can implement to define specific behavior.
Polymorphism in Java allows one interface to be used for different data types, enabling method overloading and overriding.
A dictionary in Python is an unordered collection of key-value pairs. It is defined using curly braces {}.
What is the difference between a list and a tuple
A list is mutable (can be changed), while a tuple is immutable (cannot be changed) after creation.
PEP 8 is the official style guide for writing Python code to maintain readability and consistency.
A lambda function in Python is an anonymous function defined using the 'lambda' keyword for quick, simple operations.
Supervised learning is a type of ML where the model is trained on labeled data to make predictions.
Overfitting occurs when a model learns the training data too well and performs poorly on unseen data.
Feature scaling is the process of normalizing data to ensure all features contribute equally to model performance.
A confusion matrix is a table used to evaluate a model’s performance by comparing predictions with actual outcomes.
A neural network is a computational model inspired by the human brain, consisting of interconnected layers of nodes.
Backpropagation is an algorithm for training neural networks by adjusting weights based on prediction errors.
What is a convolutional neural network (CNN)
A CNN is a deep learning model specialized in processing grid-like data, such as images.
A loss function quantifies the difference between predicted and actual values to guide model optimization.
